title: Pregnancy Care: From Conception to Delivery
headline: This free online course will teach you about pregnancy care from conception to delivery, including postpartum care.
description: Are you expecting a baby or planning to start a family? In this course, you will learn about the different stages of pregnancy, as well as the physical impact of pregnancy on women. You'll study the process of childbirth and the medical care required by the mother and child before and after delivery. We'll discuss the importance of breastfeeding newborns, mothers' emotional well-being, and common pregnancy complications.
courseDescription:
During pregnancy, a woman's body undergoes many changes to support the growth and development of the foetus. To ensure the health and well-being of both mother and baby, the mother must receive proper care and follow all necessary guidelines throughout the pregnancy. In this course, you will learn about the anatomy of the female reproductive system, the common physical changes during pregnancy, foetal development, and ways to check foetal well-being. Nutrition during pregnancy is crucial as it plays a vital role in the growth and development of the foetus and the mother's health. We'll show you the importance of nutrition during pregnancy and the factors that affect the nutritional intake of expectant mothers. Explore the factors that risk pregnant women's health, such as work, substance abuse, and social environments.

Regular, rhythmic, and powerful uterine contractions that begin gradually and you cannot stop are considered 'true' labour. You'll study different stages of labour and the necessities and procedures of childbirth. We'll teach you how to provide postnatal care, care to a woman and her baby after birth, to the mother and how to recognise and address any warning signs such as infections and bleeding. You'll study the nutritional properties of human milk, the proper way to breastfeed and common breastfeeding difficulties. Mental health issues during and after pregnancy can include depression, anxiety, and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). You'll explore the changing feelings and emotions during pregnancy and ways to improve the psychological health of a mother. In addition, we'll examine various complications that can occur during pregnancy and how to recognise and manage them.

We designed this course for women who need to care for themselves during pregnancy or those who plan to have a baby. It is also helpful for midwives and other healthcare professionals specialising in caring for mothers and babies during pregnancy. Gain valuable knowledge and insights into this complicated topic of pregnancy and childbirth. While pregnancy care is primarily the responsibility of healthcare professionals, all individuals need a basic understanding, as it affects individuals and families personally. The course content is written in plain and straightforward language, making it uncomplicated for anyone to understand and apply the information provided. Join now to learn more about pregnancy care!
